Name: China, LLC.: Qing Dynasty and Guomindang 1644-1949
Description:
China, LLC. is a game of China from the establishment of the Qing Dynasty in 1644 CE to the end of the Chinese Civil War of 1949 CE. Philip Jelley uses the same system as the popular Rome, Inc. in which you run China like a business, expanding its corporate power across China, Manchuria, Mongolia, Xinjiang, Tibet and the Southern and Eastern Seas until it becomes the largest, richest, most populous entity in the world. From the height of power, the Qing CEOs became increasingly detached from reality, confined to their palaces, and dominated by managerial eunuchs while their vast empire is beset by internal rebellions and new barbarians from across the far seas. Can you succeed where they failed? Even if Qing fall, you have a second chance as the Guomindang (Chinese Nationalist Party) struggle to bring order out of the chaos of a crumbling empire.

Statesmen may become emperors, governors, rebels, and enemy leaders and are rated for their Military, Administration, Popularity, and Intrigue abilities. Each has a special ability, allowing them to defeat their historic foes, assassinate rivals, and influence foreign affairs. For example, the Emperor Qianlong has two Military, five Administration, two Popularity, and four Intrigue abilities, and the Conquest special ability, making him an indifferent general, but excellent bureaucrat even if he was reluctant to embrace popular reform, who expanded the Qing Empire to its greatest extent. Less useful is the Empress Cixi with one Military, two Administration, two Popularity, and four Intrigue abilities, and the Assassin special ability, whose habit of killing emperors destabilized the Qing Dynasty.

The map has provinces grouped into ten commands, each with their own governor to collect taxes, crush insurgents, fight wars, or perhaps assassinate the emperor, or launch a rebellion. Victory is determined by annexing provinces, defeating wars, financing massive prestige projects, and establishing the Mandate of Heaven. Cavalry, infantry, and fleets are used to fight wars and garrison provinces, expanding direct control, or creating vassals in outlying provinces. Enemy leaders and wars move from province to province until defeated, encouraging revolts, causing unrest, reducing income, but fighting them could lead to disaster. Unequal Treaties imposed on China by foreign powers robbing her of provinces, prestige, and cash and changing the rules as they expand their own empires.

Each turn represents 5-10 years, with 10 turns in each scenario. The four scenarios start in 1644 CE, 1735 CE, 1820 CE, and 1889 CE which may be combined into campaign games. You need to blend military acumen with careful administration, as well as intrigue, making the most of what you have each turn, just like any modern-day business. China, LLC will give you a new perception of how war is a cost, business is a benefit, and empire is somewhere in between. It’s up to you to find a balance, or heads will roll. China, LLC comes with one full color 22" x 34" mapsheet, 280 full color 1/2" die-cut pieces and around 12 pages of rules. Players should average from 3 to 4 hours per scenario.

-description from designer
Families: History: Opium Wars and Taiping Rebellion

Name: burncycle: Robophobia Expansion
Description:
This expansion adds new captain cards and chips, mods cards, mission cards, equipment cards and dice, new bots chips and cards, terminal cards, and adaptive missions cards.

The content was revealed as stretch goals during the Gamefound campaign.

Name: burncycle: The Renegades Expansion
Description:
This expansion provides four new bots with a very particular set of skills to the players' team in burncycle - the mole Packet, medic Lithium, grifter Cathode, and bruiser Torrent.

This expansion adds 4 bot cards, chips, and awareness chips, 3 ability chips, and 2 bot dice.

Name: Victory at Sea: USS Arizona
Description:
Ships in Class: Arizona, Pennsylvania

Length: 600 feet
Displacement: 39,224 tons
Speed: 21 knots
Crew: 1720
Commissioned: 1916

1941: Sunk at Pearl Harbor

-description from the publisher's product information card

Name: Victory at Sea: Kirishima
Description:
Ships in Class: Kongo, Hisi, Kirishima, Haruna

The Kongo class, dating from 1912, was rebuilt between 1927 and 1931 and was thereafter re-rated as a battleship. Armed with eight 14-inch guns in dual turrets and a secondary battery of sixteen 6-inch guns, the Kongo was further rebuilt in the late 1930s. Hiel and Kirishima were lost off Guadalcanal. Hiel was disabled after taking fifty or more hits from 8 inch and smaller shells, and finally sunk by air-launched torpedoes. Kirishima was shattered by battleship gunfire, while Kongo was torpedoed by a submarine, and Haruna sunk by an air raid on Kuro.

-description from the publisher's product info card

Name: Victory at Sea: German Altmark Tanker
Description:
The oil these tankers provided proved to be the life blood for nations and their armed forces, and often represented the single most important ships within convoys.

Length: 500 feet
Displacement: 7250 tons
Speed: 16 knots
Crew: 50
Commissioned: 1939

-description from the publisher's product info card

Name: TGC Community Anthology
Description:
The Game Crafter Community Anthology Volume One is the very first collection of games designed by members of The Game Crafter’s vibrant community for the TGC Community Anthology Competition.

With 78 games from Abducted to Zombomination, there’s something for everyone. Just turn the page to fight zombies, clean up the beach, battle aliens, run your own pizza place, become the most popular kid in school, play some beach vollyball, and so much more!

Each game takes up only two pages, which lay flat for easy play. All the pieces you need are included along with a handy cloth bag for storage.

Pick and choose or play through them all to find your favorites! With play times ranging from under five minutes up to an hour, you’re sure to find something to play with family, friends, or even solo. You may never be bored again!

Thanks to the generosity of the game designers, The Community Anthology is being offered at production cost. That means no mark up, no profit sharing - just 162 pages of fun for as little money as possible. It’s only 60 cents per game!

Name: Harry Potter: Exploding Snap!
Description:
A fast paced game with explosive possibilities! Act quickly to get rid of all of your cards! No taking turns! At any moment, the game may explode and change who's winning! This card game based on the Wizarding World of Harry Potter is for 2 players ages 5 and up.

Exploding snap card game
    2 players
    Ages 5 and up
    Imported

All information is subject to change including but not limited to artwork, design, release dates, edition sizes and prices.
This item was created for and sold in the Universal Orlando theme park. Available here for a limited time.

Name: Moonrakers: The Endless
Description:
A pack of 10 demigods...

Includes 10 Crew cards and sleeves. This expansion is compatible with all versions & player counts of Moonrakers.

Name: Poker d'Enfer: Recueil des Variantes card
Description:
Promo card given by the French gaming magazine Jeux sur un Plateau, June 2006, No 38.

The new card enables the higherst visible Poker card to be used as the Joker

Name: Babylon 5 Collectable Card Game: The Great War – Opposition Factions Starter Deck
Description:
Opposition Factions
60 Card Supplement Deck
Not a Stand-Alone Starter Deck.

—description from the front of the box

THE GREAT WAR - The Babylon Project was our last hope for peace. It failed. The year is 2261. War has broken out between the ancient and powerful Shadow and Vorlon races. Like two giants fighting in a sandbox, neither side seems to care who gets crushed in-between them...

During this moment of crisis, what if Lord Refa had overcome Londo and set the course for the Centauri Republic? Or what if Neroon had gained the upper hand over Delenn? Find out by supplementing your decks with cards that make them playable as factions opposed to the B5 Ambassadors. Utilize new "Faction Leader" versions of Refa and Neroon as well as Earth's V.P. Clark and Na'Far of the Nam. Also included are cards and rules for playing games with multiple factions of the same race.

The Collectable Card Game brings to life all the action, combat and heroism portrayed in the climactic episodes of the Hugo award winning Babylon 5 series. Now internal struggles magnify the danger presented by external foes. YOUR actions will decide what happens next…

—description from the back of the box

Name: Kennst du Nürnberg?
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 on a tour through Nürnberg and have to reach space 106. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players or the players lose or gain game coins. After the end of the game the player with the most coins wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Murder of the Black Rose: A Puzzle Magazine
Description:
Your help is needed to solve a murder at a rose show!
A well known rose show judge lies next to her beloved rose bush...

Solve fun puzzles, riddles and ciphers to unravel the mystery and catch the killer! Murder of the Black Rose is an escape-room style murder mystery in a magazine format.

Name: Meeples & Monsters: The Four Towers and Solo Expansion
Description:
Aside from Locations, the City board holds four great Towers, one in each district. These Towers have also been under attack. Heroes are required to undertake tasks to help recover artifacts, relieve key figures besieged by enemies, and even to understand the very darkness itself that threatens the country of Rowan - and many of these secrets lie in the Towers.

—description from the publisher

Name: Guatafac: El punto G
Description:
NEW GUATAFAC! DIFFERENT THEMES TO LIVEN UP YOUR PARTIES!

In GUATAFAC 3, you have 8 seconds to discover the deepest thoughts of your friends, family or even strangers. You can find 480 cards with different categories such as: chill, confession, hot and hangover, as well as "Truth or Dare" or "The freak".

Contents:
420 categorised cards (chill, confession, hot and hangover).
60 special cards ("Truth vs. Dare" and "The Freak").
1 free app to download.
 Game rules:
Form a small pack of cards in the centre of the table, face down. The player who has not dipped for the longest time is called "Master Guatafac".

The Master of Guatafac will read the first card to the player on his left.

The player will have 8 seconds to answer: download our App "Guatafac" on Google Play or App Store to count them ;)

If you give the answers in less than 8 seconds and the Guatafac Master accepts them, you keep the card and win a point. After answering, you will be the Master. Then, it's your turn. Read a card to the player on your left and so on.

The first player to score 7 points is declared the GOD or GODDESS of Guatafac (don't forget to count them between drinks!).

End of the game: The player who finishes with the most "HOT" cards will have to give a lap dance to the player who finishes with the most "Chill" cards.

Name: Katas
Description:
Katas is a game about tidying up, putting your food in the refrigerator and your clothes in the wardrobe.

Players reveal a number of cards equal to the players, and then take turns either pulling a chip from a bag to place on one of the cards or taking a card and the chips on it.  After everyone has taken a card, they can activate the effect of one of the cards they've taken.

After a number of rounds the game ends and players earn points for items in the correct location, lose points for items in the wrong location, and may earn a bonus.  The player with the most points wins.

Name: Boston Massacre
Description:
Boston Massacre is a 5-10 player game of deception, hidden identity and battle of wits. With cunning play, weapon mastery and influence, you will seek to win the Revolution either as a Patriot or Redcoat. Benedict Arnold, a spy for the Redcoats, may steal a victory from the Patriots if he can gain enough trust.

Summary of Gameplay: 1). Players are randomly given player cards (Patriot, Redcoat or Benedict). 2). Everyone closes their eyes and the Redcoats and Benedict open their eyes to see each other; 3). Then the game begins along with a full on war of deceit, persuasion and cunning weapon play. 4). The first team to win 5 battles wins the game. 5). Benedict should remain discreet through the process. If revealed to be a Redcoat spy they compromise their chance for an early Redcoat Victory!

—description from the designer

Name: Jungle Panic
Description:
POSITIONING, OBSERVATION AND SPEED GAME

Panic in the jungle: hippopotamuses, snakes and cheetahs
are out of control and threatening nature’s tranquillity!
Let’s help them calm down by creating spaces specially
for each species.

Everybody plays at once in this game of speed, where each
player is trying to grab the tile they need in order to gather
6 animals from the same species. At the end of the game,
the player with the most points wins.

-description from publisher

Name: Pamięć Dźwiękowa
Description: PamiÄ™Ä‡ DÅºwiÄ™kowa ("Sound Memory") is a great way to have fun while learning attentive listening and sound memorization techniques. It helps develop the aural memory and improve hand-eye-ear coordination. The players try to memorize sounds and match them in pairs.

Name: The Farmer and the Deal
Description:
The old farm owner at the farm you used to work at has agreed to rent out a bit of land to you at a discount. As part of the deal you must also provide produce for the restaurant he has an agreement with and provide some compost for the old farmer later in the year. In this solitaire standard deck card game, the player holds the deck sideways in their hand while placing cards sticking vertically out of the deck to dig plots (spades), plant seeds (clubs), care for crops (hearts), and finally sell them (diamonds) or compost them. Played over the course of 2 seasons (turns through the deck), the player must weigh choices carefully to ensure that they use their plots before they reach the top of the deck and don't discard too many of the cards they need to sell/compost enough to meet all the farmer's requirements.

—description from the designer

Name: Kifkis
Description:
Roll dice, challenge your logic and first discover the way to reach fantastic worlds.

Randomly distribute the Worlds cards on the table. Place a random Kifki on each world.

The two dice are thrown simultaneously, to find out which Kifki needs our help (hereinafter Active Kifki) and the number of moves they must make to reach the Right World. Immediately everyone will do the tour but EYE it has to be mentally, nothing to use your hands! When everyone thinks they have reached the Right World, they should touch the card with one finger. If the kifkif die shows multicolor, the first color that someone says will be the Active Kifki.

Kifkis always make the first move by going to the World Card of their color. Then, and if it is necessary for it to continue moving, it will continue its journey towards the World of the color of the Kifki with which it finds itself when landing.

The Active Kifki makes as many moves as indicated on the die, reaching the Right World. Once everyone has drawn a card, the course will be checked to see who gets the point. Whoever has marked the Right World first wins 1 point. In the event that no one has guessed right, no one will add points.

Name: Puppy Fuffle
Description: Two to four players spin a spinner and race around the board trying to collect as many dog treats and toys as they can in this preschool game. Players store treats in their dog holes and can even steal treats from each other. When all of the treats have been collected from the main gameboard, the player with the most treats wins.

Name: Sigil
Description:
Sigil is an abstract strategy dueling game.

Place stones to surround and crush opposing pieces. A board of Sigil is populated by 9 random spells. If you fully control a spell, you may sacrifice your stones in it for a powerful effect.

Can you outwit your opponent and gain control of the Sigil?

A game of Sigil ends either when one player has a 3-stone advantage, or when either player casts their 6th spell. Whoever has the most stones wins.

-description from publisher

Name: Pax Renaissance: 2nd Edition – Age of Reformation Promo Cards
Description:
Suppose the Fourth Crusade’s Sack of Constantinople never happened, allowing the Second Rome of the Byzantines to suppress the sudden rise of the Ottoman Turks. They may find support from the Russians, with whom they share the Orthodox Religion, and maybe the Austrians and the French after the Catholic-Protestant split. After all, they had already survived the Fall of Rome, the Persians, the Arabs, the Bulgarians, the Seijuk Turks, the Rus, the Vikings, and the Crusaders. They may even survive to the present day as a Greek state with traces of Roman influence.

All cards are intended to be used with the 1550 Map Variant (see C1c). Use Reformist Theocracies for the starting England and HRE states, and the 2 new mapcards for the starting Hungary and Ottoman medieval states. Trebizond starts busted instead of the Red Sea. Replace the original Empire cards for Ottoman and Hungary with the new promo Empire cards, and only use the new Empire card for Papal States if the Papal States turns into a Reformation or Muslim Theocracy. The new Victory Square should be used in addition to the original ones, for a total of five Victory Squares. The new Banker overlay cards should be placed on top of an existing Banker placard (any Banker placard may be replaced). The new market cards should be mixed in with their respective deck.

Promo pack for Pax Renaissance 2nd ed. includes:

3 new Empire cards
9 new Market cards (5 west and 4 east)
1 new Victory Squares
2 new Map cards
2 new Banker overlay cards (Alvaro Mendes & Cornelius Berenberg)

-description from publisher's website

Name: Dune: Imperium – Immortality
Description:
The Bene Tleilax advance their own agenda by trading in genetic innovations. Will you hire Face Dancer spies of unmatched skill? Regrow damaged tissue and organs? Or dare to employ people restored to life as gholas?

Make shadowy deals with the Tleilaxu to harvest genetic specimens. Unlock the potential of scientific research. Graft cards together to empower your Agents.

Explore a universe of possibilities with Dune: Imperium – Immortality.

—description from the publisher
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Akvárko: Promo 2
Description:
"Albi exclusive" promo cards - preorder bonus for customers who purchased the game on the website of the Czech publisher/distributor Albi.

This promo pack contains 6 Sawbwa Barb (Sawbwa resplendens) cards.

ADDITIONAL RULES: At the start of the game each player takes one card of Sawbwa barb. Players can put it into their fish tank anytime during the game.

ABILITY: Sawbwa is a wild card. You can put it everywhere around the grid or cover another fish in your fish tank. You can score Sawbwa barb as exactly one type of fish you need and score the points according to its condition.

Name: Frostgrave: Second Edition – Fireheart
Description:
This supplement for Frostgrave: Fantasy Wargames  in the Frozen City provides a study of constructs, offering expanded rules for their creation, modification, and even re-animation. It examines enchanters' workshops, detailing new magic items and base modifications that aid in the animation process, and also includes a bestiary full of new constructs. Of course, much of the knowledge that was once lost still exists in the frozen ruins, so the book also features several scenarios set in the once-great factories where the art of construct creation reached its pinnacle.

—description from the publisher

Name: 18 Holes: Course Architect – Kickstarter Promo
Description: Special Kickstarter promo which includes new goals, prime locations and designer discretion cards.

Name: Postcard Coral Sea
Description:
Micro game necessitated by postcard format.
11 day and night turns.  SECRET Allied code-breaking possibility to get Yorktown as well as Lexington fleet carriers.
Neat Port Moresby landing rule:  number of surviving (of 11) Japanese transports plus UnDamaged shore-bombarding Japanese cruiser units roll 2 dice to see if they take it.  Battle can continue in following game turn.
Japanese Surprise advantage possible if Surface Combat happens and is at night.
HORRIBLE weather 50% contact capability even in same hex! Air ops:  blind 1st wave airstrike, PBY&Mavis Recon, 2nd wave airstrike, with possibility of 1st wave catching an enemy 2nd wave on deck.
High Altitude bombers CAN be risked at Low Altitude.
It's a little monster.  }:-)
Diminuation of Coral Sea:  Naval Battle for Australia, May 1942 minigame which I have yet to finish.
Plays in about an hour.  This one can go extremely either way, and fast.

And anyone is free to print this or my other 3 (so far) postcard games off in postcard format ... as long as my copyright statement and the Dedication are retained ... to mail/give to family and friends.

(Of course, for your own personal copy you will want to photocopy-enlarge the components ... the front at both A4 (for the units) and A3 (for the chart) and the back/rules as large as you need them. :-) )

—description from the designer

Name: Eirakuchotori
Description:
Eirakuchotori is one of the main streets in Dadaocheng. It was the moment when Japan ruled Taiwan. Players play as the local merchants and send theirs helpers to the various buildings for gaining the special resources and Victory points. As the game ends, the player who gains the most victory points is the greatest merchant in Dadaocheng.

Eirakuchotori is a two player game and is the twist of the mancala mechanism.

In player's turn, players choose one of the  two options to perform. 1. gain 1 rice and send 3 merchants to the street. 2. choose one building with your own mechant(s) and perform the power of the building.

When the game meets the conditions below, the game ends:

     The returning slots are full.
     There are 5 merchants deployed on the buildings.


—description from the designer

Name: GA-GA
Description:
You can either win by calling "Miyabi" proudly or get defeated by other player's "Miyabi-Gasane!".

The goal of the game is to "avoid getting drunk" as much as possible while discarding or picking up the four elegant cards {Mai=dance, Cha=tea, Incense, and Fan} and the slightly disturbing cards {Ogre and Tsurugi=sword}.  The game ends when one player becomes too drunk; The least drunken player wins.

A single game consists of multiple rounds.  The flow of rounds are as follows.

     Seven cards are dealt to each player.
     According to the rules, the player reduces the total of the cards in his/her hand.  If the total of the cards in his/her hand is under 7, he/she can call "Miyabi" and challenge to win the round.
     Everyone reveals their hand.
     If the total of the cards in hand is higher than the player who called "Miyabi", he/she loses and gets the total of the cards in his/her hand as drunkenness points.
     If any player has a total of the cards less than the player who called "Miyabi", he/she succeeds in "Miyabi-Gasane" and wins. The player who called "Miyabi" will get his/her total of the cards plus 30 drunkenness points.


The game ends when any player reaches 109 drunkenness points or more. A player with the lowest drunkenness point becomes the winner.

Once you play GA-GA, you will become addicted: The exhilarating feeling of discarding many cards at once while keeping an eye on other players' faces, reading a flow of the game, deep strategic thinking, and so on...  Please enjoy this beautiful and glittering Japanese board game!

Name: LastFairyTale: Story of Grim and Anderson
Description:
LastFairyTale is an asymmetric strategy card game with a concept that grants the wishes of the characters in the fairy tales we saw as children.

The characters from the Brothers Grimm and Andersen fairy tales we are familiar with each have their own wishes in their story. These wishes were realized as 'victory conditions' for each character.
Each character has their own unique character action to reach the 'victory condition', and it is a game in which the character's actions interfere with the opponent and reach the 'victory condition' first.

However, in most games with 'various types of characters', the problem of balance is always on the rise. There were always strong characters or cards, and when everyone played with strong characters and cards, the interest in the game would diminish.

This game is the first board game used to balance the game, introducing AI to play this game in the testing phase.
LastFairyTale's optimized AI based on Hanabi Play artificial intelligence performs test play through an average of 30 million simulations per turn.
After training the AI â€‹â€‹through these test plays, it goes through millions of battles to find the best play. Through this tests, we can check this character's strengths and weaknesses in advance, and find the best-balanced character action.

—description from the publisher

Name: Jim Henson's Labyrinth: Chess Set
Description:
In celebration of Jim Henson’s imagination we are releasing this highly collectible chess set. It features finely detailed figurines sculpted by Johny Fraser-Allen.

A traditional chess set, played in the traditional way. Also has an alternate side with the board to play 'Shurro'. Shurro is a game derived from chess, by the mind of Alessio Cavatore.

It allows you to choose your own ‘chess army’ before every game, so that each player will have a different set of pieces. The obstacles on the board also change position every time you play, ensuring that each game will present new challenges. It’s chess, but not as you know it.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Jim Henson's Board Game Collection (River Horse)

Name: CoraQuest: Bob the Blob Promo
Description:
Originally available during the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter Pack A.

A new enemy for CoraQuest plus a QR code for a linked downloadable quest, a family dungeon crawling game.

Special ability: Every time Big Bob takes damage, spawn one Mini Bob for each damage taken (see quest for details).  Mini Bobs can pass through (but not end a Move action on) squares occupied by heroes.

-description from designer

Name: Akvárko: Promo 1
Description:
"Albi exclusive" promo cards. They can only be obtained at events organized by the publisher Albi, distributor presentations, contests, etc.

This promo pack contains 6 Peaceful betta (Betta Imbellis) cards.

RULES: Shuffle all six cards into a deck with all other fish and creatures. The general rules are without any change.

ADJACENCY: This condition will be fulfilled when the Peaceful betta is surrounded by at least 2 plants for getting 5 points or 3 and more plants for getting 9 points.

Name: Kangaroo Disco Mania
Description:
Kangaroo Disco Mania is a fun, family friendly game centered around matching icons on custom cards to get the most points for the craziest moves. Each card has charming, custom artwork centered around animals doing the Disco. The game typically plays in 10-15 minutes and has multiple game modes to scale the gameplay in the interest of maintaining that quick-paced play. All modes except the solo mode have a built-in timer made up of cards, called the "song", that can be claimed for additional points but also shortening the game time.

The core of the game is centered around matching arrays of icons along the tops and bottoms of the cards to get the most points. It is a simple enough concept to allow younger family members to play, however the ability to continue playing if you set up "perfect matches" allows strategies to pull off crazy and long combinations that will keep more experienced players having fun alongside them. In addition to its quick gameplay, the game lacks a true "fail" condition and players who go out on their turn are turned into audience members with a new set of actions that can still influence the rest of the "dancers" still playing for points.

-description from designer

Name: The Little Flower Shop Duel
Description:
Spend a relaxing day creating a beautiful display on the shelves in your little flower shop.  Carefully arrange bouquets in pretty vases, place them on your shelves, and add cute little knickknacks. Make your shop the envy of all other florists with the prettiest display!

In The Little Flower Shop Duel, you and your opponent compete to take flowers, vases, and knickknacks used to create your shop display.  The game is based on the original card-drafting game, The Little Flower Shop, in which players choose flowers, vases, and hanging plants to decorate their shop window.

In this BYOP (Bring Your Own Pencil) game, players choose items from the warehouse and use those to fill their shops.  Players are not only trying to collect sets of flowers to match certain vases, but some of the flowers will become more valuable as the game progresses.

—description from designer

Name: Intergalactic Ace
Description:
You are a hotshot, rookie fighter pilot.  You are looking to prove you have what it takes to be the best in the galaxy by being the first of your opponents to get 5 Kills and become an Intergalactic Ace.

In the simple, strategy/chance game, Intergalactic Ace, players compete to be the first to shoot down 5 enemy ships. Upgrade your ship to prepare for battle, take your chances in Dogfights against Enemy Cards, and go head-to-head with other players to steal their hard-earned Kills.

Each game comes with 6 beautiful laser-cut wooden spaceships to keep track of each players' stats and Kill count. Additionally, each game has 50 stat marker pegs, 32 kill markers, 50 cards, and 2 dice.

—description from the designer

Name: Railroad Ink Challenge: Collector's Edition
Description:
The prestigious Railroad Ink Challenge: Collector’s Edition has everything you may desire to make your game collection really shine! Core games, expansions, and additional materials will surely allow you to reach networking nirvana!

Railroad Ink Challenge is a quick-playing roll-and-write game for 1 to 4 players. Grab a board and a dry-erase marker, and get ready to reach networking nirvana! Roll the dice and draw the routes to connect the exits around your board. Expand your network with railways, highways and stations to collect points, but you will be penalized for any open connections, so plan carefully!

Railroad Ink Challenge has everything you love from the original Railroad Ink games and a lot more, with an all-new focus on player interaction thanks to in-game goals! Only those who achieve them first get the reward, so you have to keep an eye on what your opponents are doing and try to complete the goals before they do! A different set of goals is available each time, so no two games will be the same!

But wait, there's more! Draw unprecedented, mind-bending route configurations thanks to the new dice! Connect special structures to your network to trigger new effects: factories allow you to duplicate a die, villages give bonus points if they are close to a station, universities unlock extra special routes — use these effects wisely and you'll score big!

—description from publisher
Families: Components: Dry Erase Markers / Dry Erase Surfaces

Name: CoraQuest: Keep on Questing
Description:
An expansion to CoraQuest, a family dungeon crawling board game, that adds campaign rules to the base game.

Players are now able to level up your heroes between quests, and also keep treasure from one adventure to another.  There are two full campaigns included -  “The Curse of Hoodez” and “A Spotter’s Guide to the Dungeon”.  Each campaign contains five brand-new adventures to play through.

There is also very simple guidance on how to turn the base game adventures into a campaign, as well as write your own campaigns yourself.

There are also new “Environments” to CoraQuest. And of course there are tons more heroes, enemies, treasure cards, and dungeon cards for you to play with too.

—description from the designer

Name: Planet Flipper
Description:
In an age where extraterrestrial stabilization technology is no longer science fiction, you set out to find your fortune settling the final frontier.

Your job is to comb the galaxy in search of hospitable planets, stabilize those planets with necessary facilities, and then sell them to wealthy clients in the market for their own private planet.

The more facilities and structures you develop, the higher your planet’s value will be, and the more your clients will pay. However, time is not on your side! With only a finite supply of oxygen available to you on your travels, you’ll have to get the job done quickly or go home empty handed.

—description from the publisher

Name: Western Legends: Spieleschmiede Promo Pack
Description:
The bundle of promo cards was sold at the Spieleschmiede crowdfunding project by publisher Corax Games

It contains:
- Western Legends: Carbine Promo Cards
- Western Legends: Man in Black Promo Card
- Western Legends: The Man In Black â€“ Multiplayer Variant Promo Cards
- Western Legends: Big Box Promo Pack
- Strongbox card

All in German.

Name: Wheat & Ale
Description:
On the banks of an ancient river, they gather to grow wheat, brew ale, and accidentally start a civilization.

Wheat & Ale is a coffee-break-length non-violent civilization builder you can play with a pencil and three six-sided dice. Combine higher dice to build, and use low dice to activate buildings. Provide food and drink for your population, and build temples to improve production.

Name: Freezing Inferno
Description:
Freezing Inferno is a 1 or 2 players wargame set in World War 2 covering the 1939-1940 conflict between the USSR and Finland.  It is a hex & counter game with unique battle mechanism, a lot of strategy, some diplomacy and a number of features specific to the harsh winter conditions of the setting. Freezing Inferno is medium level complexity and lasts from 3 to 6 hours. Variable setup and random cards bringing effects to the game offers replayability.

Freezing Inferno is a game for one to two players. If played in two players, one player controls Finland, while the other player controls the USSR.

In order for the USSR to win, it must occupy 2 of the 3 Finnish Key Cities (marked with an asterisk) and hold them until the beginning of the next round, while also controlling at least 5 of its 7 Home Cities. If this is not achieved by the end of the 8th round, the winner of the game is the player who controls Finland.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: WQRDLES: A Tactile Wordle-Like Multi-Player Word Deduction Game
Description:
A Secret Word Deduction Game  
Updated August 18, 2023

WQRDLES is a word guessing game for two or more players, generally aged 7+. Each player must guess their own word, one which an opponent has provided for them. All players play at once - no moderator is required. 
    
COMPONENTS 
• Dry erase decoding boards  
• Dry erase markers
• Dry erase racks.
 OVERVIEW 
The goal of WQRDLES is to guess your own secret word - one secretly created by an opponent.  
Each player thinks of a word, writes it down in secret and hides it from an opponent. 
All opponents can see all secret words, except their own.
Players write down words to query against their own secret word. Any opponent compares the word against the secret word and encodes an answer in the form of X’s and O’s. 
“X” means the letter is in the secret word but in the wrong spot
“O” means the letter is in the secret word and in the right spot.
     
INITIAL SETUP 
1. Give each player a decoding board, a rack and dry erase marker.
2. Each player thinks of a five-letter word and secretly writes it on their rack.
3. Each player passes their rack upside down to the player on their right.
4. Each player carefully flips over their new rack so that it is visible by all players except their self.

GAME PLAY 
Players write down a five-letter “query” word on their decoding board and pass the board to any player to decode.
The receiving player decodes the word against the other player’s secret word and returns the board.
The receiving player now examines the result and decides upon the next query word to use.
All players play simultaneously and game play can be quick.
 
DECODING & MARKING MATCHING LETTERS 
Each player will be decoding the query word of an opponent. You must accurately mark each letter of the query word against the letters in the player’s secret word.  
Mark an “X” for a letter that is in the word but in the wrong spot. Fill the square for a letter in the identical position.

For example, the secret word is HOUSE. 
The query word is SHAPE. 
Three letters are in common and the “E” is the only letter in the correct place. Fill in the box for the “E” and mark the other letters with “X”. 
  
Optionally, indicate that the secret word is lower than SHAPE by marking “<”.

PLAY IN ROUNDS 
At the start of each round, clear your decoding board,  except for your score. Continue with game play as above.

SCORING 
When a player guesses their word, the value in the leftmost box (1-6) is their score for the round. Add that number to the existing score and mark the current score on their decoding board. 
  
TRACKING MISSING LETTERS 
Mark the A-Z letters at the bottom of your decoding board that you have determining are not in your secret word.

ENDING THE GAME 
The game is over once five rounds have been completed. The player with the highest score is the winner. In the case of a tie, erase your board (except for the score) and play one more round.

INCORRECT DECODING PENALTY 
If a player incorrectly decodes their word, they cannot receive any points for that round. It is very important to be accurate in decoding your opponent’s word.

ALTERNATE WAYS TO PLAY  
1. For an easier game, use four-letter words. 
2. Use the < and > markers as additional clues. 
< means the secret word is alphabetically lower than the query word (eg BACON <  STRIP), in other words, “go lower”.
> means the secret word is alphabetically higher than the query word (eg WAGON  > TRAIN ), “go higher”.
  
STRATEGIES 
To narrow down and home in on your secret word, pick query words that alternate the known letters.

-description from designer
Families: Components: Dry Erase Markers / Dry Erase Surfaces

Name: Jeu de Paume
Description:
A trivia racing game commemorating the 200th anniversary of the French Revolution.

Answer questions correctly and move toward the center of the board. First to get there and answer three questions correctly, wins.

Name: Risky ITZI
Description:
Risky ITZI, It’z simple! It’z fast! It’z R-rated laughs! Risky ITZI is one of the newest creations from the award-winning duo that brought you TENZI, SLAPZI, ITZI, and PAIRZI. Risky ITZI is an easy to learn, fast paced card matching word game that rewards creativity and warped thinking. Quick, name a drink with bubbles that starts with “C.” If you said, “Champagne” or “Cola,” you pretty much know how to play. Risky ITZI is super-simple to learn, and super-fast to play! Be the first to get rid of your 5 letter cards to win. There’s not just one way to play Risky ITZI, there’s plenty of fun, “colorful” twists. Risky ITZI is a great choice for your next adult game night, party, girl’s night, road trip, or any other time you’re looking for fun, fast-paced entertainment. A ton of laughs went into making this game and we think you’ll get just as many out of playing it.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cosmic Encounter: Demon Promo Alien
Description: The Demon promo was a promotional alien and flare given by Fantasy Flight Games to attendees of CosmicCon 2014. It was later included in Fantasy Flight Games' 42nd Anniversary Edition of Cosmic Encounter.

Name: StarForce Commander
Description:
StarForce Commander is a game of tactical starship combat. It uses streamlined and intuitive game mechanics so you can focus on tactical decision-making. You are NOT merely resolving the battle by doing bookkeeping and rolling dice. You have decisions to make, and your decisions matter. There are tactical tradeoffs for every choice. This is an accessible and fun game, whether you are a new cadet or a crusty old spacer. Optional rules let you tailor the complexity to your preferences.

Check Out our first instructional video on YouTube. THis video covers Basic Maneuvering, or search for "StarForce Commander Mariner Games" to find other videos as we add them.

https://youtu.be/iT6T6sQeBak

As the Captain, you decide where the ship’s emphasis is; weapons, shields, or maneuvering? You will manage individual ships by allocating energy, arming weapons, maintaining shields, using sensors, and deciding how to outmaneuver your opponent. It sounds like a lot, but most ships have 6-8 points of energy to distribute, so you won’t need an accounting staff! Your crew works out details.

Strike the right balance between weapons, maneuvering, shields, and sensors to gain an advantage on your enemy. Weapons require power and have firing arcs, so you must maneuver to hit the enemy where they are weak. Your ship has four shields protecting all sides, so maneuvering, repairing, and reinforcing weakened shields are vital to survival. Seven turn templates handle maneuvering for 20-60 degree turns depending on your ship’s speed and maneuverability.

Managing a ship is easy enough that with a bit of practice, you can promote yourself to commodore and command 3-4 ships, or even admiral if you want to fight a larger battle. A game takes about 45 minutes per ship on the board, though duels can finish more quickly.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tennessee Waltz
Description:
A light, tactical abstract game played with stones on the intersections of a triangular grid in the shape of a hexagon. Complexity varies with board size. The goal is to form pairs of stones and keep them from merging.

The board starts empty, with players alternating in placing a stone of their color onto an empty node of the board.

When the placement forms a pair, the player chooses a grid direction in which to move the pair, pushing all the stones in front of them one step. However, the move must not cause any of the opponent's stones to be pushed off the board, nor may either stone of the pair, itself, move directly off the board. (Other friendly stones can be pushed off by the move, if desired.) The moving player becomes the leader if, after the push, he now has more pairs of stones than the opponent.

The game ends when both players elect to pass, or when the player who doesn't have the leader's token has no way to form a new pair in the future. Then the leader wins. Playing time is shown for an  order 4 board, which is the smallest playable size.

—description from the designer

Name: Monopoly: Edizione Rimini
Description: Edition of the historic board game set in the charming Italian city of Rimini.

Name: 300 Pop Questions: 80's
Description:
A simple quiz game with 4 variations. All the games described fundamentally are won by the player who scores the most points after a pre-agreed time.

In all the slightly different games, you get two points for a correct answer. If you cannot answer the question, it is offered to the next player for 1 bonus point. The questions relate to pop music in various decades depending on which box you bought.

Name: 300 Pop Questions: 70's
Description:
A simple quiz game with 4 variations. All the games described fundamentally are won by the player who scores the most points after a pre-agreed time.

In all the slightly different games, you get two points for a correct answer. If you cannot answer the question, it is offered to the next player for 1 bonus point. The questions relate to pop music in various decades depending on which box you bought.

Name: Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination – Webcomics Chums
Description:
115 expansion cards (of all types) created by 20 top webcomics artists, including Jeph Jacques, Zach Weinersmith, Ryan North, Andrew Hussie, Meredith Gran, Dylan Meconis, Jess Fink, R K Milholland, KC Green, R Stevens, and OTHERS!

Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination is a storytelling game set in a world in which a machine can predict how a person will die with 100% accuracy with only a small blood sample. However, the machine delights in being vague and twisted. A card reading "Old Age" could mean you die in your sleep at age 120, or it could mean you're run over tomorrow by an elderly driver who forgot to take his pills today. Players of the game take the role of assassins, who must use the various tools at their disposal -- from storytelling to a slew of items available from specialty Black Market shops -- to create a situation in which a target is killed in a way in line with their Death Prediction. The Machine of Death Game uses this basic idea, of assassins working in a world were cause of death is known to create various game modes.

The General Gameplay of most modes works like this:

• A target is assigned, and given certain details (including Death Prediction, and possibly extra details like a favourite food or crippling phobia).
• Players – assassins – are given Black Market Gift Cards. This is their inventory, what they have to use in order to accomplish their goal: killing the target.
• Players use the Gift Cards to devise a plan.
• The plan is greenlit, either by a Chief player, or via consensus, depending on game mode.
• The timer starts and the plan is put into action. This is represented by dice rolling to beat a "difficulty score." An unlikely plan hinging on a single item may need to roll a 6 for that item, but a rock-solid intricate plan may need to only roll a 2 for all Black Market Gift Cards used.
• The plan is revised, in case of failure of one or more dice rolls. The details of this portion vary greatly from mode to mode, but involve either replacing Black Market Items, creating a new viable plan with the existing items, or calling in "Specialists"
• The target is either killed or escapes. Again, depending on mode, this is either the end of the round or the game.

Game Modes:


    Head-to-Head Mode that's very similar to Cards Against Humanity or Apples to Apples. There's a judge ("the Chief"), who decides whose assassination plan is the best, and gives them a chance to try it out. Designed for 4+ playes.
    Co-op Mode, where you players are a team of assassins, and have to come up with a plan together to kill targets that the group comes up with.
    Co-op can be diced further: you can play individual rounds, or Mission Mode, where targets are predetermined and have different levels of difficulty. There's also the more strategic Chief Mode, where there's no timer, but the Chief can rate your plan's likelihood of success and let you take risks on whether it'll work or not.
    Cutthroat Mode, where players can actually assassinate each other (should you want a more competitive version)
    The Day Off Mode, which isn't about murder at all but rather draws upon your bevy of assassin skills to accomplish tasks like "opening a stuck jam jar" and "transplanting a tulip bulb."

Name: UNO: The Simpsons Springfield Edition
Description:
Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color, number, or word to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile, and if still unable to play, they pass their turn. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit.

America's #1 brand of family games arrives in Springfield, USA to bring you a game of Uno you will never forget. Uno: The Simpsons Springfield Edition pays tribute to the most outrageous Springfield residents and hometown celebrities. Apu, Barney, Moe, the Sea Captain and many more are featured on 112 Custom Cards and packaged in a collectible tin. Groundskeeper Willie even makes a special appearance in the exclusive "Great Scott" card and rule. So grab your own dysfunctional family and friends and be the first to reach 500 points to win this wacky game!
Families: Series: World's Smallest Games Series (Super impulse)
Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Tail of the Dragon (fan expansion for Tide of Iron)
Description:
The Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941, was the impetus for the United States’ entrance into World War II

Tide of Iron: Tail of the Dragon, a custom fanmade expansion for Tide of Iron, features the introduction of the Japanese army and the Pacific Theatre battles, including new terrain tiles, new rules, new units, new scenarios, and fifteen new geomorphic double-sided map boards.

—description from the designer

Name: Hi MiLo!: A Cooperative Trick-Taking Card Game
Description:
Hi MiLo! is cooperative trick-taking game for 1 to 5 players where the rules for playing cards and winning tricks changes for each trick based on the unique Hi MiLo! Deck.  Your team strategy will never be the same twice as the Hi MiLo! Deck is shuffled between rounds creating a whole new set of rules for every game!  After seeing their cards, players bid to take the highest, middle, and lowest number of tricks in a round.  Without discussing their cards, players work cooperatively to take tricks which would allow each player to make their bid.  If all players successfully make their bids, the team wins together!

Cardplay Overview
Hi Milo! is a trick-taking game like Hearts, Spades, or Bridge, and follows many of the same rules as those classic games.  Each player places one card face up on the table and one wins the trick based on the value of the cards.  However, Hi Milo! is unique in that the Hi Milo! Deck determines the rules for which cards you can play and which cards will win any trick.  The Win Card for the trick is collected by the winner of the trick, and the next Win Card determines the rules for the next trick.  The Win Card determines the rules for a trick in two ways.  First, players must play a card of the same suit as the Win Card if possible.  If the Win Card has no suit, players can play any cards and only the number value determines the winner.  Second, the rank of the Win Card determines who wins the trick.  If the Win Card is ranked “Hi”, the highest value card wins the trick.  If it is “Lo”, the lowest value card wins the trick.  If it is “Mi”, the player who played the card in the middle of the highest and lowest cards wins the trick.

—description from the designer

Name: Ozark: Money, Influence and Control
Description: Like the television series, the board game Ozark is all about money laundering. In this territory-control game, each player's faction must control various locations from the series and try to end up with the most money at the end of the game.

Name: Rolling Dungeons
Description:
You and your friends become brave warriors and take the first step in the dungeon.

You roll two dice and follow the dice, catch the monsters, open the treasure box, rest, and finally catch the boss monster.

Who can take over the dungeon the fastest?

-description from the designer drawanything

Name: Ring Rivals
Description:
Ring Rivals is a quick-fire competitive wrestling card game.

Players choose from a pool of wrestlers with differing strengths and weaknesses and play cards to attempt to beat their opponents in rounds of stat comparisons, allowing them to pin and knock their opponents out of the game until they are the last one remaining.

Each player will have a hand of cards with varying effects and usefulness and must also manage their own stamina resource to survive their opponents' attacks.

—description from the designer

Name: Töchterpensionat auf Reisen
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 0 (home). Whoever reaches space 120 (Frankfurt a. M.) first, wins the game. At some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published as a supplement in "Das Kränzchen, 2. Jahrgang".

—user summary

Name: Chrysanthemum
Description:
A Natural Fantasy Strategy Game where players are Faeries who compete to plant the most flowers on the World Bloom.

Chrysanthemum's core gameplay involves gathering seeds in the center of the World Bloom then venturing out onto its petal tips to plant the seeds and collect Guild Runes.

Guild Runes enable you to learn spells from the Card Drafting Area. With spells, you can plant and collect seeds at a faster rate, disrupt your opponents, travel across the World Bloom more efficiently, and exchange or enhance your resources. Using spells also increases your chances of finding a Bloom card, which causes the World Bloom to expand, giving you access to many new Guild Runes, spells, and places to plant seeds.

You win a game of Chrysanthemum by being the player with the most flowers on the World Bloom.

—description from the publisher

Name: UNSCREWED
Description:
Due to dwindling ratings, the Blammo! Network can only afford to keep one of their notorious Saturday morning cartoons on the air, but they can't decide which!
â€‹
â€‹You control the misfit characters from these cartoons in a televised fight to the death, concocting schemes and watching them go hilariously wrong. You'll try to out-scheme each other, using game changing Quirks, and an arsenal of cartoon weaponry to attack each other and survive a map that's out to kill you - all to keep your show from being cancelled.

The last player standing wins!

Name: The Long Road: Action Cards
Description:
Nine additional action cards released as stretch goals during the kickstarter campaign. The following cards are included:

"Breakdown"
"Stragglers" x2 cards
"Forget That!"
"Refugees" x2 cards
"Lost"
"Command Decision"
"Soften Them Up!"

These new action cards expand gameplay by adding new, unplanned events to challenge players. They were packaged together but outside/separate of the core game box.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Dragonvault
Description:
Dragonvault is a fantasy card game for 2-8 players created by The Dragonfather. First Edition was a limited run and all current decks are Second Edition.

Each player chooses a champion. Then, they take turns drawing from a central deck, collecting treasure and facing greedy dragons, dangerous traps and other perils.

Name: Loop House
Description:
Loop House is a deduction micro game. The current version is for 3-4 players. Players act the invited visitors to the house and attempt to find the most valuable itmes in the house.

In each turn, players choose one action card from their hands and show the cards simultaneously. Then, perform the played action card by the room order. The players may take one item from the room, or use one item in hand, or exchange the items from the room.

After 3 rounds(days), the player with the most valuable items win the game.

-description from designer

Name: Dark Eon
Description:
Dark Eon is a fast-paced card game for combining with the Ai drawings. Players attempt to find out the most powerful creatures and the unique artifacts. The player with the most victory point is the winner.

During the turn, players may either choose to draw a card from the deck, or choose the opponent to battle, if the active player have two hands.

Before the battle, the defender may perform the power of the artifact first. Then the attacker may perform their artifact. Then both players evaluate the streghth of both creatures and determine who win the battle.

—description from the designer

Name: Detective Ray vs P the thief
Description:
Detective Ray vs P the thief is a mirco game for 150 bg convention. The concept is from my 5 years old son. Keep the core the game and extend the game play by creating 2 more expansions for the game.

Base game:
Start player flips the card. If the flipped cards are 3 in row, the the active player win the game. If not, the opponent close the eyes and the active player must reorganise the flipped cards and flip them over. The game continues unitl the end confidtion is meet.

Tool Expansion:
During the setup, the players randomly choose a tool card. They can use the power of the tool card the whole game.

3/4 players Expansion:
Add 7 cards to the base game. The players may guess who is the thief during the turn.

Mission Expansion:
During the setup, the players randomly choose 2 mission cards. If they flip the cards set as same as the mission card, the players finish the mission card and gain one victory point. The player who is the first player gain 2 victory points wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: A General Game of Pyrates!
Description:
A General Game of Pyrates is a solitaire game of swashbuckling adventure set during the golden age of the buccaneers and pirates roving the Caribbean Sea between 1630-1730. You will lead your crew and become the most wealth or famous (or both!) pirate crew sailing the Spanish Main. You will need to track prizes, divvy up plunder, and piece together treasure maps to chart your route to Fame and Fortune, all while trying to avoid the hangman's noose!

—description from the designer

Name: Asturias 1936-1937
Description:
Wargame of the Asturias Front in the Spanish Civil War.
Asturias 1936-1937 can be played on full campaign or one of the three scenarios: Insurrection, Grado Corridor and Final Offensive.
Asturias was the last Loyalist stronghold in the Northern Front, so the Nationalist player will try to break the defensive lines and reach Oviedo and Gijon to win this game.
The board shows the Asturias province a point-to-point map, and the counters are battalion-size units. 
The Nationalist player will count with the help of Colonial units, also Italian and German planes.

—description from the designer

Juego sobre el Frente de Asturias en la Guerra Civil Española.
Contempla toda la campaña completa, desde la Sublevación hasta la Ofensiva Final, aunque pueden jugarse tres escenarios de manera independiente: Sublevación, Pasillo de Grado y la Ofensiva Final.
Asturias fue el último baluarte de la República en el Frente Norte, y el jugador Nacional debe tratar de romper las defensas republicanas para socorrer Oviedo y, si es posible, conquistar Gijón para liquidar este frente.
El tablero muestra la región de Asturias y provincias limítrofes en un mapa punto-a-punto, mientras que las fichas muestran unidades tipo batallón. El jugador nacional cuenta con el apoyo de unidades del Ejército de África, y las aviaciones italiana y alemana.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

Name: Athangudi: Artisans of Chettinad
Description:
Athangudi (pronounced Aa-thun-gu-dee) is a tiny South Indian village located in Chettinad region, in Tamil Nadu. It is famous for hand-made floor tiles made by artisans of the village. Using a limited colour palette and  geometric motifs,  these tiles create intricate patterns with symmetry and repetitiveness and are coveted by architects and home-owners alike.

In this game, you play the role of a master artisan who has to lay the floor of a Chettinad Mansion using Athangudi tiles. You compete with other players to lay the most impressive floor & to score the highest to win.

All players progressively lay their own floor of 16 tiles in a 4x4 grid in front of them. The floor is built over four rounds. Each round involves each player picking four tiles from a central supply, keeping one they want & passing the remainder clockwise around the table. By drafting one tile from a progressively depleting pile that's passed by each player around the table, you collect four tiles each round. You can temporarily store these tiles while you wait for a better one, or place them on your floor to score points. Tiles placed in the floor are "set in cement" & cannot be changed for the rest of the game.

You can score points by completing motifs, sequences or goals. Scoring is done at the end of each round, so completing motifs, sequences or goals earlier in the game can help you score higher. At the end of the game, you also score for neatness of the floor, so make sure you're tidy while playing!

The final score is the sum of the scores of the four rounds, plus the end game scoring. The highest score wins.

-description from publisher

Name: Seasons of a Tree
Description:
A trick-taking game where the trump suit can change with the seasons. Anytime you cannot follow a suit card (i.e. Summer) you can play a card of the next season (Fall) to change the trump.

But beware the Ax cards; if a trick has one of those, you lose all the trees in that trick!

—description from the publisher

Name: Kingdomess
Description:
Kingdomess is the micro card game for 150 bg convention.

The players attempt to build the most prestigious kingdom by laying kingdom cards. During the game, they may attack opponents' kingdoms by laying their cards onto the opponents' kingdom cards. The greatest king is the one who have the most victory point in the end of the game.

In player's turn, player either player one card from their hands, or upgrade one card which is not stacked by the other cards. The required resources are paid by removing the cubes in their own kingdom.

The game ends when all players pass.

—description from the designer

Name: 形棋 (Shape Chess)
Description:
Shape Chess is a combinatorial game for 2 players, which can be played with a Renju set.

During the game, players’ goal is to build up reflectional symmetric shapes with his/her own stones. To achieve this goal, players can either Drop a own-stone on a empty point, Jump a own-stone to another empty point, or Push an opponent's stone to an adajcent empty point by droping an own-stone. Points are given according to the size of the symmetric shape, and the winner will be the player who reach 4 points first.

Name: Dueling Llamas
Description:
THE FIRST LLAMA PERSON WHO GETS FIVE LLAMAS IN THEIR HERD WINS!

You and your fellow Llama Ranchers are battling it out to see who can get five llamas from the Yellow Herd Cards first! Use cash to purchase llamas and add them to your herd, or Action Cards to steal llamas from other players' herds! It's great for Ages 8 and up, and for 2-6 players.

BUT WATCH OUT FOR NINJA LLAMAS!

Good advice in this game and in real life! Players can use Red Action Cards to disrupt your path to victory by deploying Ninja Llamas, or by forcing you to Feed, Groom and Pet other Llamas in exchange for cash. Not happy with the cards in your hand? Just play a Llama Swap and everyone passes their hand to the left! Sayonara Llamas! Want to cause some drama? Play Drama Llama and choose an opponent to lose their next turn.

THIS HERD AIN'T BIG ENOUGH FOR THE BOTH OF US!

If you want to take a chance at winning, or are desperate to stop one of your fellow ranchers, then it's time for a Duel! Call out an opponent with the Cowboy Llama and duel, Rock/Paper/Scissors style! But duels are risky! If you win, you get one of the llamas from their herd, but if you lose, they get one of yours.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kotki
Description:
Collect treats and toys on your pillow by drawing cards. Be careful about how many, so the card with the dog won't stop you.

In your turn, you can either prepare treats on your pillow or attract cats by offering those treats. Each cat has different value and like different things. Some might even help you in your next moves with their special skills.

Whoever scores 10 points first or 15 in longer version, wins.

Name: Three-man Chess
Description:
Three-Man Chess was invented by George R. Dekle Sr. in 1984. It is played on a hexagonal board with 96 quadrilateral cells.

For the most part, three-man chess follows all the normal rules of two-player chess. Different rules only apply in the center of the board. There, bishops can change color, and pawns can capture on three different squares.

The game is won by the first player to checkmate an opponent.

Name: Worn Wanderers: Cast of Steel
Description:
Worn Wanderers is the world's first Trading Pin Game, but more importantly, it's a game that you can wear! That means that you can play when and wherever you come across someone else sporting their Worn Wanderers character pins.

To play Worn Wanderers, you assemble a team of six unique characters, each represented by a beautiful enamel pin, and customize them with wearable cards that represent the weapons your characters use, the attacks they make, and the loot they guard!

The object of Worn Wanderers is to use your nomad’s attacks (represented by the cards you assign them) to defeat your opponent’s characters and steal the most loot. Beware, though! As you thwart characters’ low-level defenses, you’ll strengthen their resolve and drive them to use more powerful weapons against you to protect what few resources they have!

Gameplay consists of turns where you pick a member of your warband to attack an enemy character, with each dealing damage to the other. Stay alert though; it isn’t always about having the higher stats! The hardened survivors you battle may enlist their cohorts for powerful combo attacks, pierce your armor for extra damage, lay traps for your characters, or more!

—description from the publisher

Name: Potion Pot Trail
Description:
Potion Pot Trail is a puzzle and resource management roll and write game in which players assume the roles of alchemists preparing to open their new potion shops. 
With only ten days to brew potions to sell, they ride off into the forest in their enchanted potion pots to gather ingredients. 
However, these handy potion pots leave a trail of ruined ingredients in their wake, preventing players from harvesting in locations they’ve already passed through.
Players will need to plan ahead, choosing the direction and distance of their moves carefully, in order to visit the hexes containing the ingredients they seek. Along the way, they can brew up potions to earn extra ingredients, additional actions, and helpful enchantments.
With a clever strategy and some skillful maneuvering, they should be able to line their shelves with potions in time for opening day.

Name: Fire in the Steppe: 49th Mountain Corps
Description:
The massive tank battle at Brody-Dubno in June 1941 included the two divisions of the German 49th Mountain Corps and the Adolf Hitler Life Guard Motorized Regiment of the Waffen SS party militia. These battles were not included in Fire in the Steppe, based on the clashes at Brody and Dubno, since Fire in the Steppe doesn’t include pieces for German mountain troops or SS.

49th Mountain Corps is a Campaign Study, a short book adding 10 scenarios based on these battles to Fire in the Steppe.

To play those 10 scenarios (which come with two battle games, too), you’ll also need Fire in the Steppe, Parachutes Over Crete and Slovakia’s War.

Name: Panzer Grenadier: Lithuania's Iron Wolves
Description:
Surrounded by three hostile powers — Poland, Germany and the Soviet Union — Lithuania chose not to resist their imperialist advances during the Second World War. The Lithuanian Army consisted of but three infantry divisions, a cavalry brigade and a small tank detachment. But many within the political and military hierarchy, including dictator Antanas Smetona, wished to fight.

Lithuania’s Iron Wolves is an expansion book adding the Lithuanian Army to the Panzer Grenadier system. The 18 scenarios are based on the sort of fighting the Lithuanians saw as likely against the Germans, Poles or Soviets. They’re organized into four chapters with battle games, in our popular story-arc format. They’re not playable alone; you’ll need Fire in the Steppe, Kursk: South Flank, 1940: The Fall of France and The Deluge to play them all.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Il Sangue del Barbaro
Description:
Relive the mythical deeds of the barbarian described by the pen of Robert E. Howard in an anthology at crossroads between mortal trials, monstrous creatures and evil sorcerers taken from the original tales of the master of the Sword & Sorcery genre: The elephant tower, The palace of the the dead, The God in the Urn, The Palace Intruders and The Ice King's Daughter.

For the first time the best Italian authors of interactive fiction join forces to create a story with numerous alternative endings set in the unexplored corners of the Hyborian continent, from the Cimmerian villages to the corrupt heart of the City of Thieves, passing through the icy peaks of Nordheim.

Antonio Costantini, Andrea Tupac Mollica, Alberto Orsini, Lorenzo Trenti and Valentino Sergi are the exceptional signatures of this project for which an innovative Deck System has been created consisting of 3 different sets of cards. Now it's time to take up the sword and go on an adventure! For Crom! A truly epic game book!

Name: Andromeda Run
Description:
A card game where players race to complete the Andromeda Run, with as much cargo as possible. Players command a Flagship with different strengths and weaknesses, expanding their fleet and capabilities as they overcome obstacles and events to race to the finish, set in the Andromeda Galaxy.

Every turn players take turns in drawing cards, and playing them. These cards could take the form of distance traveled, upgrades to their ship, cargo or extra ships for their fleet. Events occur which the player or players (depending on conflict mode or not) overcome for rewards.

The Game ends when a fleet arrives at the target distance traveled. The players are given bonus points depending on how far they have traveled or how much cargo they have brought with them. The highest score wins.

-description from designer

Name: Masters of the Universe: Battleground – Wave 1: Evil Warriors Faction
Description:
Skeletor appears on the battlefield and summons the terror-awakening evil ghost, Scareglow, from the dimension of Infinita along with his trusted henchman, the wild Beast Man. He will provide his allies with teleports to facilitate movement around the arena.

EXPANSION PACK INCLUDES:

     1x Set of additional rules
     1x Manual
     2x Evil Warriors miniatures
     16x Various cards
     2x Terrain accessories
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Pizza Party
Description:
In this TMNT themed memory game, 2-4 players try to get ingredients for their pizzas.

On their turn, a player rolls either a D6 with numbers 1-3 or a regular D6 to grab that many ingredients for their pizza, but making sure there are no duplicates or flies in the newly flipped ingredients (you can have duplicates with the ingredients already on the pizza). The first player to have 12 ingredients wins the game.

If you flip a fly, your turn ends and you get no ingredients, but you have to put the fly on the pizza of a another player that doesn’t already have one.

If you have a fly on your pizza, you have to roll the regular D6.
Families: Comic Books: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

Name: Railway Rivals Map E: Atlantic & Lake Erie (1980/85)
Description: Game board size: 59,5 x 41.5 cm

Name: Mini Rogue: Death Bat & Fence Promo cards
Description:
Death Bat & Fence are two promo cards for Mini Rogue, packaged together.

     The Death Bat is a deadly new monster that will suck your vitality.
     The Fence is a new merchant that sells items at a discount but beware, these goods may be cursed.


The base game is required to play these. They were originally released at Essen 2022.

Name: Ice Cream Truck Wars
Description:
Ice Cream Truck Wars is a roll & write print and play game where both players own Ice Cream Trucks and are throwing ice cream at each other. You're throwing ice cream left and right, often 4 or more ice cream in one turn, trying to hit goats, people, trucks, bridges, trees, dogs, and more...

It is a roll & write game that uses worker placement for competitive action selection, triple use cards, asymmetric abilities, dice manipulation, card drafting and a bit of hidden movement.

—description from the designer

Name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Heavy Battle Lance
Description:
The BattleMechs of a Heavy Battle Lance are brawlers who combine effective offensive power and defensive endurance.  The perfect hammer for a sommander to swing against an enemy line they need cracked wide open.

Unleash the Inner Sphere Heavy Battle Lance on your enemies!  Nightstar, Cataphract, Axeman, and Bushwacker - no assemly required - along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards.  Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!

Name: BattleTech: Battlefield Support Deck
Description:
Bring the Rain!

BattleMechs are the kings of the battlefield.  But expert use of support elements - artillery, minefields, and aerospace fighter runs - can tip the balance of battle toward victory!

This 55 card deck makes using the sleek Battlefield Support rules from the BattleMech Manual even easier.  Choose the size of your conflict, select cards to represent the support you'll bring to the battlefield, and you're ready for a game.  Unleash your cards at a critical moment to help your 'Mechs defeat your opponent!

This deck is for use by one side in a scenario.

Name: Geomondo
Description:
It's possible to know the most amazing corners of the world in a simple and super fun way!
Geomundo, a boardgame that teach us new things about different world territories.

How to play Geomundo?
Take a card and try to find out where that particular place is.
If you get it right, you will be able to answer a question related to the geography or culture of the place being presented in the card.

If you are right, you win that card and add a point on your passport “stamp”.

So, in addition to having fun, you'll learn new information about cities, monuments and countries that are part of Geomundo's 90 photos journey!

Name: The Naval SITREP The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #2
Description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #2 was published in January 1995.

Table of contents:

Folloup Strike Packages Udbina
Command at Sea Errata
Haarpoon IV scenario: Korean Counter
Tomahawk Targeting
Viking Forge Productline
Carrier Homeporting changes
Platfor Specifications:
French Charles de Gaulle Class
French Rafale M
US Fletcher Class
US SBD-4 Dauntless
Families: Magazine: The Naval SITREP – Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming

Name: Calendra
Description:
Calendra is a Celtic Themed Runic Card Game designed for 2-4 players. The game comes with: 120 playing cards, 4 seasonal rule cards, an 8 page rule book, and a sturdy cardboard box.

Players start the game by selecting a random rule card, which determines which suit they will be representing from the playing cards for the duration of the game. The mechanics feature deck-building and quick poker-like rounds of play, where each player puts one card face up on the table per turn in an attempt to form a specific combination of cards. If they form a round winning hand in a combination of suits they win the round, but if they can form a round winning hand using only cards from their own suit (in a flush) then they win the game.

Warning! Many of the cards allow you to swap cards with other players in the game. As such, the goal of this game is to outwit, trick, and deceive the other players while cleverly assembling a winning hand that cannot be prevented.

-description from designer

Name: Cussing
Description:
The elegant game of Cussing

In this simple insult-battle party game, players take turns cussing one another using only the cussword cards in their hands. Everybody gets in on judging whose cuss was best. Winner takes the points.

Name: Parachutes Over Crete: Heraklion
Description:
German paratroopers landed on Crete in May 1941, hitting four drop zones defended by Australian, New Zealand and British troops, plus hastily-organized Greek regiments and often the armed Cretan populace. Our Parachutes Over Crete game covers the air landings at Maleme, Prison Valley and Rethymno; this new Campaign Study looks at the battle for Heraklion, the capital of Crete, defended by the British 14th Brigade.

Heraklion is a Campaign Study, a short book adding nine scenarios based on these battles to Parachutes Over Crete.  To play these nine scenarios (which come with three battle games, too), you’ll also need Parachutes Over Crete and Road to Dunkirk.

—description from the publisher

Name: Panzer Grenadier: Tank Battle at Raseiniai
Description:
Tank Battle at Raiseiniai is a Campaign Study based on the June 1941 tank battle at and around Raiseiniai in Lithuania. The Soviet 3rd Mechanized Corps, assisted by 12th Mechanized Corps, counter-attacked the German 41st Motorized Corps in a series of large-scale armored clashes.

Tank Battle at Raiseiniai adds 10 new scenarios to Fire in the Steppe, split into two chapters, each with a battle game to link the scenarios together. This being an Avalanche Press product, there’s also the background story of the battle. It requires only Fire in the Steppe to play all 10 scenarios.

—description from the publisher

Name: Panzer Grenadier: New Zealand Division
Description:
Between March 1941 and November 1942, the 2nd New Zealand Division fought in all the major battles in the Western Desert, Crete and Greece. After the victory at Alamein, the Kiwis helped lead the Allied pursuit of Erwin Rommel’s fleeing Axis army across Libya and into Tunisia.

New Zealand Division is a Campaign Study based on the operations of the 2nd New Zealand Division between December 1942 (the Battle of El Agheila) and May 1943 (the fall of Tunis). The New Zealanders, down to two brigades after the destruction of 4th New Zealand Brigade in July 1942, took a lead role in the Eight Army’s penetration of the Mareth Line in southern Tunisia and fought until the Axis collapse.

New Zealand Division adds 10 new scenarios to An Army at Dawn, split into two chapters, each with a battle game to link the scenarios together. This being an Avalanche Press product, there’s also the background story of the battle. It requires only An Army at Dawn to play all 10 scenarios.

New Zealand Division also includes 88 die-cut and mounted pieces showing New Zealand troops – including the famed 28th Maori Battalion – in their own unique color scheme.

—description from the publisher

Name: Game of Queens: A Drag Queen Card Race
Description:
Who is the most outrageous–Trixie Mattel or Divine? Who is the funniest—Coco Peru or Lily Savage? Enter the world of huge hair, sparkling make-up, glitter galore, fake eyelashes, and... the fine art of the tuck and tape, with Game of Queens! Pitch queen against queen from across the carnival court of drag, from the female impersonators who pioneered drag performance in the 1970s up to the superstars of the scene today.

—description from the publisher

Name: Panzer Grenadier: Legions of Zog
Description:
Italy invaded Albania in April 1939; King Zog I’s Royal Albanian Army had been trained and equipped by Italians, who promptly sabotaged their students’ heavy weapons. The campaign lasted for five days, with the Albanians only able to offer resistance in scattered locations before the Italians crushed them.

Legions of Zog is an expansion for Panzer Grenadier: Conquest of Ethiopia, with four new scenarios and 24 new die-cut and silky-smooth pieces. You'll also need An Army at Dawn. You get the Royal Albanian Army as it stood in April 1939, having to face hordes of Italian invaders. The scenarios unfold in our unique story-arc format, with battle games to tie them together. Can you force the fascists to kneel before Zog?

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

Name: Hush: Dread Creek
Description:
August 2022 episode for Hush.

Includes:

     Map postcard: Dread Creek
     Character card: Gotra
     Nocturnal Creature card: Tilia Hearthair
     Spirit card: Slime Spirit
     Structures card: Mill / Portal
